Intro: ^The green person slowly climbed the long, intricate stairs that led to the top of the temple, his steps resolute. It didn’t took him long until he reached his destination.
^As he set his foot on the top of the temple, he stared at his foe, sitting in his golden throne.
^At first glance, one could mistake the man sitting there for an ordinary one. While handsome, his features were very much like those of his people - black hair, tanned skin and strong complexion.
^What set him apart from his peers, however, were his eyes - these deep, enchanting purple eyes who were clearly not those of a human.
^That person was, without a doubt, someone with divine blood.
^The green person, without hesitation, declared his intentions to the purple-eyed man:
^/%doggo_unknown/ JUST SHUT UP AND CONFESS YOUR CRIMES ALREADY, YOU SHADY MONK!
^…. I take a deep breath and ignore the exacerbated shout.
^/%green_person_normal/ Oh, King among Men. You, who in the height of your arrogance believes yourself to be above the Gods - by my hands, I shall deliver the punishment for your foolishness.”
^The king stared at the green person for a few seconds, tension filling the air. He then burst into laughter.

^/%king_normal/ How amusing, to think the Gods would send an envoy with such great sense of humor! And how fortunate - I’ve just claimed the head of our previous Jester, so this court is in dire need of one.
^/%king_normal/ While dropping the stoic face would surely benefit your performance, I, the King, will be willing to accept you even in your inexperience.
^The green person remained quiet in face of the king’s mockery. Irritated at the lack of a response, his opponent raised his tone:
^/%doggo_unknown/ I’M TELLING YOU IT’S USELESS! THE FILTHY SMELL OF YOUR LIES WILL NOT ESCAPE MY LULU!!!
^I let out a deep sigh, pick up my bookmark, place it on the beginning of the green person and the king’s confrontation and close the book slowly.
^I take a look around the classroom to see what kind of ridiculous situation is going on this time. It doesn’t take me long to find out it’s source.
^/%arjuna_unknown/ My, my, Miss Doggo. Please enlighten me, how do lies smell? Is it a sweet perfume, like that of a thorny rose, or is it a foul stench, like that of your precious companion’s feces?
^/%doggo_unknown/ H-how should I know, you fool? I’m a dog tamer, not a dog myself! I would appreciate if you’d drop the foolish questions!”
^/%arjuna_unknown/ Haha, I suppose I must apologize for that, Miss Doggo, but you left yourself way too open - consider it karmic retribution, shall we?
^Sitting in his table without a worry in the world is Arjuna Kumar, Spiritualist Prodigy. And fiercely interrogating him - or rather, demanding his confession - is Miss Doggo, Taming Prodigy.
^I let out another deep sigh. Nothing good could come out of involving myself with these two’s affairs, but I’m afraid my reading can only continue after I deal with whatever their trouble is.
^/%noir_normal/ Excuse me, what is going on here?”
^/%doggo_angry/ Hmph, none of YOUR concern, Noir. I don’t need any detective wannabes to tell me this shady monk is the culprit here.”
^/%arjuna_smug/ Why so hasty, Miss Doggo? I, for one, see Miss Noir’s involvement with this case as a very fortunate omen - the spirits are in much better mood now that she has arrived!”
^/%doggo_angry/ As if I care about your so-called spirits! All I need is my Lulu’s trusty nose to discern the truth! And it’s nose tells me you’re the culprit!
^/%doggo_angry/ Now, surrender peacefully, or I’ll have Lulu’s mighty fangs work their way through you!
^/%arjuna_smug/ You know, this would be a far more effective threat if you gave your dog a more intimidating name - being ran by Lulu’s fangs doesn’t sound that worrisome, I’m afraid.
^...This is going nowhere fast. Sigh, why did it have to be these two? Why aren’t there any more developed characters to work with on this demo?
^/%noir_normal/ I’d appreciate if you’d keep your dog away from the suspect, Miss Doggo. Now, Mister Kumar, could you please elaborate about what exactly is going on here?
^/%noir_normal/ So, let me get this straight. Someone stole Miss Doggo’s dog’s necktie, and she says it greatly resembles the blindfold you’re currently wearing. Is that correct?
^/%arjuna_normal/ I suppose that’s the case, yes.
^...This is beyond silly. I guess I’d better take notes of all this, in any case. Giving my notebook a check during investigation is also a good idea.
^/%doggo_angry/ That’s not all! My Lulu has tracked his necktie all the way to here! Therefore, this must undeniably be his necktie, and this shady monk must be the culprit!
^/%noir_normal/ I’d appreciate if you kept your conclusions to yourself, Miss Doggo. By narrowing down our possibilities, we stray further from the truth.”
^/%doggo_angry/ Hmpf! Do as you want, but you’re just wasting your time. And by that, I mean you're wasting MY time too!
^/%noir_normal/ *sigh* Very well. Mr. Kumar, would you mind if I asked you a few questions?
^/%arjuna_normal/ Not at all. The Lord is well aware of my innocence, and through His guidance I’m sure that I will leave this incident with a Not Guilty verdict.
^...I wasn’t aware we were standing on a courtroom. And since when is he a priest….?

Statement1: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Eu não roubei o lenço do cachorro.
Statement1Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ Você consegue provar que não roubou?
Statement1Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Até onde eu saiba, não existem provas contra mim, existem?
Statement1Press3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Mas pode ficar tranquila - tudo se esclarecerá em breve.
Statement2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Os espíritos nunca me perdoariam por um ato tão imoral, caso contrário eu seria punido pelo karma!
Statement2Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ Será que os espíritos não te perdoariam, o Espiritualista Prodígio? Acho difícil.
^/%arjuna_normal/ Uai Srta. Noir, você está me superestimando.
Statatement2Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Eu meramente me comunico com os espiritos - eles são meus amigos, por assim dizer.
Statement2Press3: ^/%arjuna_smug/ Você não ficaria zangada se seu amigo fizesse algo do tipo?
Statement3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Mas claro que eu não faria isso, mesmo sem punição alguma.
Statement3Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ Ah, você é bonzinho a esse ponto?
^/%arjuna_smug/ É claro que sou! Você acha que os espíritos aprovariam uma pessoa de más intenções?
Statement3Press2: ^/%arjuna_smug/ Além do mais, eu não sou inocente até que se prove o contrário? Eu gostaria de um pouco mais de confiança.
Statement3Press3: ^/%noir_sad/ laklkdasd acho que ele ta certo
^/%arjuna_smug/ Mas não se preocupe! Eu irei guiá-la até a verdade que deseja.
Statement4: ^/%arjuna_normal/ No fim das contas, eu nem sabia que o cachorro vestia um lenço!
MF_Talking_to_Dog: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Como você está, guardião dos portões celestiais?
^/%arjuna_normal/ Eu vejo que você carrega hoje, como de costume, a bandeira branca que guia os perdidos!
^/%doggo_angry/ Lulu, o que está fazendo? Saia de perto deste cafajeste agora!
^/%arjuna_normal/ Está tudo bem, nobre guardião. Que seu caminho seja abençoado por Buda.
Statement4Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Devido à personalidade... exótica da Srta. Doggo, eu não falo muito com ela.
Statement4Press3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Então, raramente me encontro com o cachorro - nem sabia que ele tinha um lenço.
Statement4Ending: ^/%noir_normal/ Até eu percebi que ele tinha um lenço. Kumar está realmente distraído, ou...?
CEI_NeutralEnd: ^/%noir_normal/ Não consigo ver uma falha em seu testemunho... Mas se ele está mentindo, suas memórias devem traí-lo em algum momento.
CEI_Objection: ^/%noir_normal/ OXE SR. KUMAR, TAS DE BRINCANAGEM COM MINHA FACE?
^/%arjuna_smug/ Excuse me? I spoke nothing but the truth, you see.
^/%noir_normal/ Q PORRA EH ESSA DE BANDEIRA NA MINHA MAO RAPEIZE?
^/%noir_normal/ RAPAZ SO FICA QUIETO. ESCUTA AQUI. VC VAI ME FAZER UMA MASSAGEM
^/%arjuna_shocked/ W-wait a second, Miss Noir! Calling it a lie is exaggerating! /%arjuna_normal/ Please, allow me to make up for my mistake!

Statement1: ^/%arjuna_normal/ I’ll admit to having knowledge of the Necktie, all right. May the spirits forgive me for that terrible lie.
Statement1Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ Is that all the spirits will have to forgive you from?
^/%arjuna_smug/ Now now, Miss Noir. Such a heavy judgement is unbefitting from you.
Statement1Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ ’Hate the sin, love the sinner.’ Isn’t that how it goes?
Statement1Ending: ^/%noir_normal/ I’d really appreciate if he chose a religion and stuck to it…
Statement2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ However, I must still deny stealing it.
Statement2Press1: ^/%arjuna_smug/ Now now, Miss Noir, is it really appropriate for a detective to object to the suspect’s choice of words?
Statement2Press2: ^/%arjuna_smug/ I am innocent. Therefore, I must deny being guilty. Do you have any objections to that?
Statement2Press3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Then may we proceed, with the blessings of the Buddha.
Statement3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Miss Doggo’s claim is that it rests on my face at this very moment, isn’t it?
Statement3Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ That’s what I’ve heard, yes. Do you deny it?
^/%arjuna_normal/ Patience, Miss Noir. All shall be revealed as the heavens deem fitting.
Statement3Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Hm...? Oh, is that so? I see.... /%arjuna_smug/ How fortunate! It so happens that they deem it fitting to be revealed in my next statement.
Statement3Press3: ^/%arjuna_smug/ I’d ask you to wait patiently as I once again guide you closer to the truth.
Statement3Ending: ^/%noir_sad/ I’d say you’ve been guiding me AWAY from it….
Statement4: ^/%arjuna_normal/ That’s all but impossible. As the spirits would know, I’ve been wearing this blindfold ever since I left my dorm room!
Statement4Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ That… would be the entire day. You’ve been wearing it this whole time?
^/%arjuna_normal/ I’d have believed it to be clear enough, Miss Noir.
Statement4Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Ever since I left my dorm room, I didn’t took my blindfold off once.
Statement4Ending: ^/%noir_normal/ He sure is fond of that blindfold…
CEII_NeutralEnd: ^/%noir_normal/ Wearing a blindfold the entire day…. Is that even possible? Well, I kept my hair over my eye the entire day…. Wait, did I? I’m not so sure…
CEII_Objection: ^/%noir_normal/ Mr. Kumar, can you remind me of which day of the week it is today?
^/%arjuna_normal/ Hm… Although some religions would have different calendars, I’m led to believe today is a Wednesd /%arjuna_shocked/ -- ack!
^/%noir_normal/ You’ve realized it already, didn’t you? We all have medical checkups on Wednesday. I find it very odd that the doctor didn’t check your eyes during it, Mr. Kumar.
^/%arjuna_shocked/ B-but I’m blind! A lot of doctors wouldn’t do it!
^/%noir_smug/ Are you implying that the doctor hired by the Human Order Preservation Environment would incur in such a silly malpractice?
^/%arjuna_sad/ ....Okay, I concede. I did remove my blindfold during the checkup.
^/%noir_normal/ All right, I’m piercing through his lies one by one. The end shouldn’t be too far.
^/%noir_normal/ Mr Kumar, may I please ask you to testify about your actions during the checkup? Also, it would be helpful if you were completely honest in your testimony this time.

Statement1: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Yes, the doctor did ask me to remove my blindfold.
Statement1Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ And I’m assuming you did it?
^/%arjuna_normal/ Yes, I did. I gave the doctor my blindfold, and I retrieved it from her after the checkup was done.
Statement1Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ May the Gods smite me if I’m lying right now.
Statement1Ending: ^/%noir_normal/ So he is a polytheist now…?
Statement2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ But I’m wearing the same blindfold right now.
Statement2Press1: ^/%arjuna_normal/ Don’t ask me. Ask the doctor.
Statement2Press2: ^/%arjuna_normal/ And before you ask, no, I didn’t touch my blindfold after the checkup was done.
Statement2Press3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ The blindfold I’ve wore after the checkup is the same I’m wearing right now.
Statement2Ending: ^/%noir_normal/ He’s oddly resolute right now… Yet something about this feels off....
Statement3: ^/%arjuna_normal/ As such, I can’t be the thief!
Statement3Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ ...W-What if you’re just keeping the blindfold on your pocket, and that’s where the smell is coming from?!?
Statement3Press2: ^/%arjuna_smug/ After all, that’s such a childish remark that I’d doubt your proficiency as a Detective were it not a jest.
Statement3Press3: ^/%arjuna_smug/ However, the Lord is merciful, and, as his envoy, I shall extend unto thee His mercy and forgive you even said it! I’m such a good person, am I not? I wonder why I’m even being suspected of theft!
Statement3Ending: ^/%noir_sad/ Was that such a weak remark that even Arjuna is mocking me…? /%noir_normal/ Better think twice before my next objection.
CEIII_NeutralEnd: ^/%noir_normal/ I can see no flaw in his testimony so far… But he was trying to hide the Checkup…. He must be hiding something else about it.
CEIII_Objection: ^/%noir_normal/ Mr. Kumar, there is a blatant contradiction in this statement!
^/%arjuna_normal/ Now, Miss Noir, I’m afraid you’re just grasping at the straws. The Heavens can attest that I did not lie in my previous statement.
^/%arjuna_normal/ You say the Medical Checkup Report contradicts me? Where is that contradiction?
Objection_Failed: ^/%noir_smug/ Here is your contradiction for you!
^/%arjuna_smug/ Hm…. the spirits fail to pick any negative energies from that page you’ve shown me. Are you sure the Report contradicts me?
Objection_Sucessful: ^/%noir_normal/ Mr. Kumar, take a look at the name of the Doctor written in this report.
^/%arjuna_angry/ Miss Noir, now that’s just in poor taste. Asking a blind person to read a report? I’d have expected more from you.
^/%noir_shocked/ Ack! /%noir_sad/ Ahem, Hm, erm, I - I apologize. /%noir_normal/ In any case, the name written in this report is Guy Fooks. Does that sound odd to you?
^/%arjuna_shocked/ Wait, Dr. Fooks?! T-That’s impossible! I’m sure my checkup was done by a woman!
^/%noir_normal/ That’s not what the report says, mind you.
^/%arjuna_shocked/ P-perhaps the boys  are checked by a female doctor, while the girls are checked by a male one?
^/noir_normal/ ...Let's accept that reasoning for now. /%noir_smug/ Do tell, Mr. Kumar - were any of your previous checkups done by a female doctor?
^/%arjuna_sad/ ...No. I’ve always been checked up by Dr. Fooks.
^/%noir_normal/ Will you confess to your lie, then?
^/%arjuna_shocked/ N-n-nonono! Please, wait a second! I swear in the Lord’s name, I did not lie about this! I was checked up by a female doctor!
^/%noir_normal/  Hmm, now this is odd…. Though he contradicts the evidence, his mind isn’t betraying his words…. Is he really saying the truth?
^/%noir_normal/ Mr. Kumar. I’ll have you testimony about your medical checkup in full length.
^/%arjuna_normal/ Yes, Miss Noir! I’ll have you see it for yourself that I’m not lying about this!

Statement1: ^/%arjuna_normal/ I found it weird that Dr. Fooks wasn’t the the doctor doing the check-up this time.
Statement1Press1: ^/%noir_normal/ And you did nothing about it?
^>The spirits recognized her as a legitimate doctor, so I believed in their judgement.
^>Besides, all will be made clear as I continue my testimony.
^>(Noir)(Thinking): “I wish he wouldn’t rely so much on his spirits, to be honest….”
^>But it all went normally! No weird stuff going on!
^I’m Doctor Tiala. Pleased to make your acquaintance.(???)<
^So, Mr. Kumar, I’ll ask you to drink this. (Tiala)<
^There is no weird scent coming from this….(Thinking).(Arjuna)<
^The spirits find no bad omen in this, so I shall oblige.(Arjuna)<
^What’s this? I’m feeling… a little…. odd….(Thinking)(Arjuna)<
^We’re all done, Mr. Kumar. Here, have your blindfold.(Tiala)<
^It feels a little weird…. But the smell is still the same...(Thinking)(Arjuna)<
^>(Noir): That just sounded a little odd. Can you elaborate?
^>The doctor just ran me through the ordinary procedures. Just as any check-up!
^>(Noir)(Thinking): “The ordinary procedures? He seems a little unsure of it… If only I could see how this check-up went….”
^>I then left the Infirmary with my own blindfold! And that’s the whole truth!
^>(Noir): Are you completely sure she returned you your own blindfold?
^>After all, the spirits kept track of her every movement for me!
^>So she didn’t had the time to do anything suspicious at all!
^>(Noir)(Thinking): “She never had the time….? That’s an odd choice of words…. If only I could confirm that claim….”
^>(Noir)(Thinking): “There is clearly a strange part in his testimony…. I better press that for more information.”
^>(Noir): “Mr. Kumar…. During the check-up, the doctor tending to you made you ingest a certain substance, correct? I believe they were…. Anesthetics?”

^>(Noir): “I’ll take your silence as confirmation. Mr. Kumar, you do realize that, during the time you were asleep due to the effect of the anesthetics…. The doctor could have easily swapped your blindfold, correct?”
^>(Arjuna): “T-that’s preposterous! T-the spirits would never allow for such a thing!”
^>(Noir): “Do your spirits warn you of things that happen during your sleep, Mr. Kumar?”
^>(Noir): “Furthermore… would you be able to say, with full confidence, that this blindfold is indeed your own?”
^>(Noir): “With all things considered, it seems natural to me that the blindfold you’re currently wearing…. IS MS. DOGGO’S DOG’S NECKTIE!”
^>(Noir)(Thinking): “I’ve seen it all now…. That’s the truth he was hiding.”

Wrong_Objection: ^/%noir_smug/ Take a look at that, Mr. Kumar.
^/%arjuna_normal/ Uh... What about it, Miss Noir? Do you want me to check if there are any evil spirits possessing it? This won't be free of charge, of course.
^/%noir_angry/ N-no! This is the proof that you're lying!
^/%arjuna_normal/ Uh.... This has nothing to do with my previous statement, Miss Noir.
^/%arjuna_smug/ Now, now, there is no need for excuses. I understand it perfectly well.
^/%arjuna_smug/ Yes!My powerful aura is clouding your judgement, leading you to make mistakes in your assertions!
^/%arjuna_smug/ I sometimes forget about how strong of an effect my powers have on those around me. I suppose I must redicrect my energy towards....
